content.description: Prone start. You basically start this problem laying down. Haha. Anyways, start with hands matched on the low jug, reach up and use the marginal holds to get a good crimp on the arette. It was making sounds as I was climbing it so be warned, it might come off. In any event, once you have this, its just a hop, skip, and a jump to the top. Enjoy.
content.location: Furthest left problem on the Jump Skip and a Hop boulder.Â

content.description: Start low on the 2 aretes. Move up while pinching and squeezing, until you can launch to the lip.
content.location: Located on the boulder closest to the road

content.description: Start with hands matched in the huge under cling. Launch to the lip, and top out.
content.location: Located on the biggest wall of the area.

content.description: Climb the face. Start with one hand low on the arete and the other in a small fingercrack along the dihedral. Move to one of the small crimps on the face, then shoot for the lip.
content.location: Located on the boulder closest to the road.

content.description: Pretty easy vert problem. Start with one hand on the arete and another on the obvious crimp. Bump your hand up the arete & throw to the top out jug. Top out is a little weird but not too sketchy.
content.protection: Only need 1 pad, 2 if you want all your bases covered.
content.location: Arete on the teft side of the boulder which "Jump, Skip, and a Hop" is on. Just around the corner from "Up, Up, And Away".

content.description: Start low on some jugs, move up to the big shelf, then reach up to the slopey top-out.
content.location: This problem is located on the face of the boulder in the corner.

content.description: V2 or V3 depending on how low you start. Climb the left side of the face using the shelf, and mantle the top section to top out.
content.location: This problem is on the boulder closest to the road

content.description: A nice, shaded, roadside bouldering area with a concentration of problems on a few decent sized boulders.
